add_osdi_h.introTxt1: To define a new OSDI Zone navigate to where the zone will be located with the PTZ controls or by clicking in the image.
add_osdi_h.introTxt2: The camera uses the coordinates of the center of the image to set the lower left and upper right zone area. First navigate where you would like the most lower left point of the OSDI zone to be located. By clicking on the Get button the coordinates are set. Proceed to where the upper right point of the zone should be located and click on its Get button.
add_osdi_h.introHaitiTxt1: Finally, name the OSDI Zone with something descriptive and click the OK button.
add_osdi_h.introHaitiTxt2: You have now defined an OSDI zone. To have the name of the zone appear when the camera view enters the zone, go to Text Overlay Settings for more information.
add_osdi_h.introPlatoonTxt1: Finally, name the OSDI Zone with something descriptive and click the OK button.
add_osdi_h.introPlatoonTxt2: You have now defined an OSDI zone. To have the name of the zone appear when the camera view enters the zone, go to Overlay Settings for more information.

osdi_h.introTxt1: OSDI (On-Screen Directional Indicator) can be set up to give the user information on the direction the dome camera is pointing.
osdi_h.introTxt2: This page provides a list of already defined zones and the tools for creating and modifying zones. OSDI Zones are given a descriptive name to appear as text in the Overlay image. If two or more zones overlap, the name of the zone that comes first in the list will appear.
osdi_h.introHaitiTxt: See Text Overlay Settings for more information about setting up Overlay image text.
osdi_h.introPlatoonTxt: See Overlay Settings for more information about setting up Overlay image text.
osdi_h.addZoneTxt: Click the Add button to set up an OSDI Zone.
osdi_h.noteZoneTxt: Note: The image will always appear unrotated.
